Name: Carrot, Parsnip and Lentil Casserole
Notes: Recipe updated to use instant pot
Steps:
Dice onion and crush garlic together

Peel and chop Carrots and Parsnips together

Make Red Beans in instant pot if not canned
Add olive oil to a large pot and saute onion and garlic until soft.
Add the carrots and parsnips to the pan along with the stock and bring to a boil
Add the lentils, herbs, and spices. Simmer covered for 20min or until the vegetables are tender and the lentils are cooked

Meanwhile, peel and chop potatoes

Pressure cook on high for 8 min 

Make mashed potatoes

Preheat oven to 300F. Spray a casserole dish with cooking spray if needed

Mix kidney beans into the large pot with the carrot mixture. Using a slotted spoon transfer vegetables into the casserole dish, then ladle in enough liquid to cover the vegetables. 

Bake for 30-40 min. until a slight skin forms and the casserole is bubbling. You may want to cover it at this point.

Remove the casserole from the oven and carefully put spoonfuls of mashed potato onto the vegetables. 

Increase oven to 350F and return the casserole to oven and bake, uncovered for an additional 20-30 min. until potatoes begin to crisp.

Add grated parmesan and broil until slightly browned. Cool slightly and serve with warm crusty bread.
